review_title: gorgeous but can’t pick up anything
one_reviews_text: The interactions after leaving the clothing shop don’t work. Things just float when you grab them. It’s absolutely beautiful but really wish the interactive element worked. Still worth the experience just disappointed.
I used to use this app quite alot back in the day, and it´s still both in the Store and in my Library ....but now it can´t download it any more. Why isn´t this reflected on the Store page?

This is something really special.
let me discribe it like this.
Its October , the air is crist outside. im sipping coffee, as I enter the land of COCO VR. the celibration of Holloween , the land of the dead.  Its a place of beaty that cant be discribed by words.
i got myself ready. put on my cloths and entered the Town center. there is Music and laughter , Color and lights the like of which can not be compared to anything. its wonderful.   my most enjoyable time was in the art Gallery . With Coffee in hand. ( in  real life) i spent some time in here looking at the art and just enjoying the atmosphere of it all. 
i love it. im going back in there soon just for the feeling i get while exploring this 
place.

the only con is that i cant actualy pick up the paint brushes or the hats or mustches or other thiungs. please fix the interaction stuff concerning this. i really want to be able to play around with all this. but other than that its a really neat place to be in VR.

I would ABSOLUTELY love it on Quest!! This is a lovely game on Rift ! But now I would to have play time on Quest/Quest2 as most family has the updated hardware.. If there is a mod I will gladly play it!
It was boring and buggy. I would not recommend. No wonder its free no one would buy this.

This experience was great for something thats free , lots of interactables and things to look at! Wish there was more and had more music from the movie :/
This is a must to experience !!

I played this vr experience recently and was quite immersed, the only down side  to it is the limited things you can do and how close you can get to things, for example the band playing on the stairs  cant get that close unfortunately. The "cinema" doesn't let you get too close either  how ever the tram/train experience is amazing, the taking photos and dressing up is cool and being able to take your head off is fun,  I'd love  for there ti be more but for a free  experience its great.

This experience might not take more than 15 - 20 minutes to complete, but it's free - and I've paid for much worse experiences that were even shorter, lol. This is a highly polished experience. It does make you feel part of the movie.
Works perfectly using Rift CV1 ss 2.0, even with 4xMSAA, but be careful with the dynamic shadows which took me below 90 fps, even disabling antialiasing did not help. I'm using a heavily oc'ed GTX 1080.

review_title: Shallow and rough around the edges
one_reviews_text: Teleport movement, poor textures, and minimal interactions left me feeling let down. It aims to be an interactive experience and not a game, but doesnt really achieve that even. Theres an art gallery to view, a theatre to view a short, and a band playing a song. Thats really the extent of it.

For a tag-along free VR vignette based upon a movie, this felt more like a true made-for-VR “experience”. 

The artistry in this creation draws upon a fantastical blend of Spanish colonial, Art Deco, and other-worldly architecture, all with an authentic Mexican flavor. 

The acoustics of alone deserve appreciation, along with the music. The street Cinema was a delightful place to watch a few shorts.

The Museum of Arts (just off the plaza) was so enjoyable and well-designed that I left a little of it unexplored for later.

I spent over an hour just exploring and enjoying the main plaza, and once I found the exit... I immediately wanted to return. In fact, I plan to return many times with my friends to experience this place using the multiplayer option.
I love this. Very emotive. Thanks for this piece of art.
A great experience. Sort of like a trailer for the movie.
I wish the game was longer!

the game perfectly depicts VR's worth .......with all those amazing colour combination, the music.. etc was sooo mesmerising. But the hands was a bit glithy but manageable... would be amazing if we got a part 2 version with more interactivity... would definitely kill for part two!!
Best VR game i've played thus far. So detailed and beautiful color selection.

review_title: SO gloriously cool to check out.
one_reviews_text: A great free experience. Visually stunning and you feel like you're IN the movie... There would have to be so much more for me to be willing to pay, but it's a cool free experience.
very very very very very very very very very very very gooooooood
five minutes the yo dun bruh

I really loved this one. From dressing your avatar and exploring the dressing room, watching the two short film clips in the cinema, listening to the band in the square, the train ride and especially the art museum along with the avatar face painting and finally the stage performance.  So  much to see and do in this experience.  Loved every minute.  Wish I could find more like this!

Beautiful app with colorful, interesting environments of the kind you would expect from Disney. It seems to be based a little on a death cult, what with all the skeletons and other creepy iconography, but I guess that makes us a good app to run around Halloween. It’s just not a philosophy or religion I would want to have anything to do with normally.

review_title: Gorgeous art and funny things to do
one_reviews_text: I dare you to go to the photo area, you can try on hats and glasses, make a pose in the mirror and it saves the picture to your hard drive....I had a lot of fun doing that. If you talk whilst looking in the mirror the characters mouth moves, it looks like it is doing the taking. Bit clunky getting around, but worth a gander at all the things. Make sure you get out of the square on the train via the lift to the final sequence.

review_title: If You Liked The Movie You'll Love This
one_reviews_text: Every bit as gorgeous as the film. The colors absolutely pop out and the music is perfect. The only reason I give it 4 stars is because I wish it'd have been longer and included more of the film characters and scenery. Still, it's well worth the price of admission. If they'd expand it and charge $50 I'd gladly buy it.
This is really good fun considering it is a free experience and really shows an exciting future for vr.

very cool music and sound
but limited movements and interaction
at some point you ride a train, but not through an actual 3D world but seeing a 360 degree video, which stutters a lot and made me nautious
i like it
i can't play the game , there is no sound
No sound !!!
Marianne
it really brings coco to life! or death LOL!
Really enjoyed playing this with my friend :D
lit game
I love when the game gives you a solo kinda expirence cause im socialy awkward
Wow, such a visually stunning experience! I had to stop and stare for a few minutes when I was in the plaza to take it all in. I'm fairly new to VR and this will be something I remember.

First I must say dont pay attention to the negative reviuws,  VR requires   Strong PCs if you havent  got one just dont use VR it will  crash , dont blaim it to this free amazing work of art. My specs are i5 6gen, 16 gb RAM gtx 1060 6 gb ram, the app runs mega smooth with no crashes or isues  what so ever, I use oculus touch.About this interactive short film, is just mind blowing, whern you exit to the main street, omg the singers, I actually felt been there, the trip with the train, the whole thing is amazing, the future is here. I am a 3d  artist and I have to say  you guys are amazing  , just incredible
i think that this game is cool and fun
Wow. What a great experience. Really nice considdering it is free!
Great game! However when we get to the train it goes black and we do not see anything out the windows and are unable to get off? How can this be fixed?
the best VR game ever!
Bad reviews unnecessary!
Randomly crashes at at movie cuts, if I interact with controls.
wow
only teleport can by worst on games
When I first get on to the train it starts but leads into darkness but I can still hear everything. When the train stops it is still dark and I cannot get off. What is happening.

review_title: Probably the best VR movie tie in
one_reviews_text: Probably the best VR movie tie in where most are usually lacklustre
Short, but sweet with friends!
I took a look at i once more after I watched the movie and man, it´s much more fun! it´s so beautiful and emotional. I wish they put Mama Coco and the boy playing and sining remember me.
Good Experience
No words to add
This a little interactive experience and there is not much to do. Should have made a short instead like Henry or Invasion. Just ordinary. But it is free.
This is what a VR tie in should aim for. Great little experience takes about half an hour to explore and loooks beautiful.

The immersive experience offered by this game stretches the imagination of everyone regardless of their genre preferences. It's short but stunning. Perfect for children and adults. A great experience to show others not familiar with the immersiveness of VR.
I do not know what to do after you dress up your little dud. Plez tell me.

It's pretty neat that this environment is handed out for free. You can even walk around together with friends to explore.  It's a fairly limited world, but wow what a work of art!  No reason not to check it out, and bring a friend along.

Really beautiful experience. The control system is a little tricky, but the environments, music and atmosphere are beautiful.  My 5 year old daughter absolutely loves the movie, and adored this experience.
The only thing that needs a bit of improvement are the controls.  It would be amazing if they actually made a full game for VR. But this demo is definitely a step in the right direction.

The truth is that this adventure surprises by its scenarios and its immersion, a very refined and very nice adventure, Scenarios and skeletons are amazing, COCO es el mejor!!!!

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUJohz6ScpNndAuTdDAbZJg/videos
Enjoyable but short and not much to do.

I must say that I loved the way this app was made, the atmosphere and there are some genuine moments where you get lost in this world; although is leaving you a bit sour because you can see more potential for it, but it does not get there. I would gladly pay 10 dollars if the app would add more.
The positives: atmospehere for sure; voice acting is nice; and the museum of art is incredible; that is how a VR experience should be. The train ride is outstanding and the plaza environment with the singers is so good that you just sit there and listen them singing. Graphics are very nice and colorful and kids love it.
The negatives: controls are obnoxious; for good time, you won't be able to move around or do what you should do, because the pointers does not register the position. I was about to give up honestly; and there is no feature to play the experience with keyboard or joypad either. Interaction is great, but there is only few things you can do; which is a shame. The movie theater is just a glimpse and can't do much, not immersive; compared to the other activities around. Movement is a problem, since it is the "timewarp" mechanic, which is good for people with motion sickness, but give an option for free walking at this point, so people can choose what to use. Also there is not much to do, beside the museum (long experience), train and the movie area.
I hope the devs will expand this and for the future; will give us a paid experience that add a lot of playable elements and value; to have us go back more and more. I can see myself paying for a longer and deeper experience; if it is done at this level, and controls are finally fixed.

review_title: The controls are so so bad
one_reviews_text: I'm only giving this 2 stars because I loved the movie.  The controls are so clunky and glitchy, I had to give up.  I've been gaming for 20 years and couldn't figure it out.  Make something for kids to enjoy they can just watch.

It's everything you'd expect from a Disney product. It was so much fun, dressing up, painting your toon, moving around and listening to the music. It was amazing. 
Yes, I would pay for a full-length game. Thanks for the fun.
Great experience, this world is beautiful but it lacks interactions...a full game would be a big success i think ! Try it !

I've had the Rift since mid December and downloaded quite a few free and paid apps/experiences, this one is among the best so far. Excellent graphics, very immersive, joyful, really nice, it's free so all you might have to loose in case you didn't like it it's the time it takes to download and test run. I hope you enjoy it as much as I have.  : )

review_title: When pro's do VR....you can tell! NICE!
one_reviews_text:
the second I popped into the shack I knew the bar had been raised.
these developers are clearly a cut above so many of the game developers out there. the locations made me feel I was "there" more than any other VR app I have played yet.  the sites, the atmosphere, it feels like a world. and one I would love to explore. it made me feel like it was alive with people and not some dead program. looking up and seeing the mountains in the sky and the gondolas really was a nice touch.  downside? same ole same ole. no regular locomotion. and it just ruined it. these developers take the time to create these wonderful immersive worlds...and then...only allow teleporting. see, they shoot for realism in that they want to create worlds for us....but...they fall down just before the finish line. essencially punishing me because some get sick in VR. well I dont. but still I am forced to pop myself places awkwardly. alot of VR makers are starting to get hip and include both movement models,but some still dont. but
as it is because of this, its become meh to me.  anyways nice app.

After the disappointing Disney VR site this is a real stunner that makes up for their past mediocrity. A terrific recreation of the animated world of Coco that puts you in movie. Like being in a classic colorful Disney attraction with all the polish and detail we expect from Disney/Pixar. One of the best free VR experiences yet. Detail and design is excellent. Check out the great gallery display and paint your skull and be amazed at the trolley ride. Keep it up Disney and keep creating great VR! This kind of content will sell headsets!

This experience is not without it's bugs, but its an amazing effort and we loved it. A lot of art and culture crammed into this experience. We really enjoyed the art studio. If you explore enough, you can find the artist painting the "nude" skelton. My daughter and I got a good laugh. Super awesome way to dive into the world of coco. 5 stars for sure. If you're a fan, this is a can't miss. So many wonderful little treasures to be found here.
An immersive world with fun and culture, I am truly gutted it was short, a whole world could be made here and it would be a pleasure to be a part of.

review_title: This is the best game in my VR
one_reviews_text: It broke my heart that it is just a sample game to promote the movie. It made me revisit my childhood, my dream of being in disneyland came true. I hope they made a full game of coco. It was well done. Graphics is excellent, controls are nice...what else could I ask for but a full game.

review_title: Great Experience for the Price of FREE
one_reviews_text: I don't know why people are complaining about whats not included. Just be happy with what is included because it's FREE! Its a great experience and a must have.

A festival of the dead for the the kid in all of us.  Wrapped to see Disney coming up with the goods and making an immersive, well thought out, free experience to back their most recent flick.  Promotional VR experiences should rise to this standard from any serious, world class mainstream studio.  Impressed to say the least and will be one of the scarce few I revisit, if only to dance on stage like a festive skeleton
This is how its done! Lots of content, interactive and FREE. There is no shame to show this to friends, unlike Spider-Man Free commercial/demo/poo-poo.

I saw the movie Coco, loved the movie, and this definitely captured the feel of the environment the movie set out to present. Like others mentioned, the train ride was well done, the environment is beautiful, I loved the singing and even the dog movie if you watch the whole thing gave me a laugh. I think the beginning could be better executed when you are in the room and having more of the same in the Plaza could have been skipped. I wish the world was a bit larger, more interactive, more things to see. I wish they could have integrated the real world to the dead world...that bridge...which was a big focus of the movie in the cemetary..well....they should of somehow integrated that with how to get to the other side with a pass showing the family on the other end with your picture..something like that. Anyway, for what it does show, it made me smile.

review_title: Loved the movie, this is better
one_reviews_text: Videogames have been trying to get us to step into our favorite movies for a long time now; this takes us so much closer. The movie's city of the dead was so beautiful, but you couldn't really take in a lot of detail. Here, you can take your time and look around. Interraction is limited and the whole experience is a bit short, but then again, it's free, so I can't ask for much more.

Played it solo and then invited a friend and the experience was a lot more fun with someone to interact with and this led us to discover things I missed previously, like the interactive trees and you can play toss with the paper airplanes and your heads! The artwork in the Gallery was also cool to see. And the Sky Trolley, that really gave you a depth of the world. As well as, the characters were more richly animated than most games, which you'd expect from Pixar.

If you haven't played with another person yet, I found online that they also have an email that you can request a co-play with someone: cocovr.magnopus@magnopus.com

review_title: Sigh. Lovely but why a Rift exclusive?
one_reviews_text:
It makes me particularly sad as this is one of the most beautiful things in VR currently. I want to recommend it to Vive users and I want to demo it to people when I'm sitting at the Vive suite at work. Everyone should be able to try this.

I can understand exclusives when Oculus has funded development but Pixar is presumbly bank-rolling this to promote the movie?

This game (OK, really fancy ad) is simply stunning. It has both English and Spanish voice recognition and there is a ton to explore covering the Day of the Dead celebrations from an art museum, to a place to play dress up to a movie theatre, tons to see and do. though movement is currently teleportation only and that can be hit or miss. The experience can take over a half hour or just a few minutes depending on your playing style, but the breath-taking artwork and focus on culture will have you lingering. Also, your character talks when you do and minics your movements, fun to do in mirrors. The best part was the view of the city from the elevated train. Sweet and impressive for a free app.
Great interactive experience.  It's cute how if you remove your headset, your virtual head pops off.  Love the graphics! If they come out with a full gaming experience, I'll buy it!

This was a fun experience. I LOVE that you can experience this with friends. I wish they would expand this into a full fledge social app. I would love to play around more in the land of the dead. I need this as my Oculus Home!

Are so amazing in this experience. It reminded me a bit of an adventure game like Grim Fandango. The world they build is colorful and alive with characters. All the animation is extremely well done as well, particularly the main character in the beginning. I felt like I was on a Disney ride! Excellent use of 360 video as well, the perfect combo of real-time with video. Definitely want to see Coco now!

Amazing sights and sounds.  You get to get a glimpse of living in the this magical, Dia de los Muertos world of the Pixar movie Coco.  Great advertising for the movie, now I really want to see the movie.  I just wish you could do more, like actually paint your skulls or sing along with the Mariachis.  But at least you can play your caracas and act the fool on stage.  Just as a side note:  to get to the performance stage, you have to take the elevator up and get on the train/trolley ride.   At the end of the train ride, you will perform on stage.  After this performance, you will get a cut scene and reach the end.  However, you can always go back to the plaza.  ** Photos you took and saved are in your computer file folder, click on the link on your monitor while plaing the VR experience to easily view them on your PC ***

If you have any joysticks plugged in to your PC, then you won't be able to use the thumbsticks to move, which makes the whole thing totally pointless. Unplug your joysticks, and it all starts working, and then you too can enjoy this excellent teaser for Coco.
A very sweet and well made rendition of the movie. As I've never seen the actual film, I was astonished at how much I loved the world this game created. Absolutely wonderful.
A very, very charming little explorer, even if there isn't much to do but look around. But hey, it's free. Make sure to take the elevator to the cable car and look around the skyline

This is really a great experience and I'm thankful Disney/Pixar made this freely available.  My kids and I spent hours fooling around in the world.  They even made it multi-player!  I don't have anyone else to play with but I can imagine how fun it would be with relatives to play with.
Really enjoyable, makes you want to watch the movie even more than a regular trailer.

review_title: Great!  But had to search for the photos
one_reviews_text: Like most people, I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed this experience.  I found my self smiling at the end without even realizing it.  I'm not sure if it was just me, but the photos you save at the booth don't seem to go to any obvious place.  After a while I found them in User\AppData\LocalLow\Pixar\CocoVR but that definitely doesn't seem like the best place for them!
After the first intro, sound doesn't work and can't teleport. Please fix.

Had to deal with a small problem that my character was spinning but quickly found out it was due to other joysticks in my computer. Past that, I was imersed in this gorgeous Mexican world with a character with a full body and all limbs. You feel so imersed and the world is beatiful. I just wish it was bigger but hey, its free. This is the perfect demonstration to friends and family of the potential of VR. I'm in love with this. The music, the photo is just perfect. Great job!

Experience was so boring that I uninstalled half hour after installing it. Don't see what the hype is , you are a skeleton that can dress up and move around and do virtually nothing as you are limited on where you can go. Only good thing is it was free, so removing it was easy.

Have to say I wasn't expecting much from another free movie vr experience but this is crazily good. From the moment I stepped into the Plaza I just felt like I was there, the atmosphere, ambient sound and graphical style were the most gorgeous and immersive I've experienced on the rift. I haven't smiled this much playing a game since I first my Oculus and loaded up First Contact. It's absolutely sublime. Only a short experience, 10 minutes or so but such a massive variety of experiences and emotions felt in such a short time. If this was a full game I think it would be the best game on VR, it's such a quality production. Guess you would expect nothing less from Pixar. This has got me really excited for Fall Out VR. If that can capture half the atmosphere of this charming title and expand it into an entire world it's going to be amazing. I found the teleportation worked really well in this too, and as my preferred way of moving makes me think Fallout might be quite playable in this mode too. Anyway, outstanding experiences, hats off to Pixar and please make a full game so I can explore this world!

You can tell that this game was made in a hurry.  Parts of the map that disney didn't think you would look at aren't there.  Many places where you can tell the wall is 2-D or they just stopped making the map.  Also very easy to tell where the map ends and the skybox begins.  It's for sure made to educate kids about dia de los muertos but not very much content.  It's basically hey come and look at our re-creation of "dia de los muertos".  It feels like im just looking at what made not really interacting with it.

I'm giving it 5 stars besides the fact that it is a little clunky, has some bugs, is lacking some features, and could be better. Why ?  Because if Zuckerberg threw some of HIS  money at it, it would definately be a "show your friends the Rift" app.  For those of us who know how to use the Touch Controllers, the good far outweighs the bad.

I tried this with a few friends because there aren't many multiplayer experiences out there. IT IS MAYBE THE BEST MULTIPLAYER EXPERIENCE OUT THERE. I was giggling like a school girl with my friends, throwing each others heads off the trolly. Truely amazing that a movie production company was so on point. More like this please!!

omg this game is so awesome. its like being in the afterlife in mexico. by the way, in the near future when coco comes out i want you to make an update for longer gameplay throughout the entire movie. every scene, and every moment. so, the longer the game the better this is. and this game should be longer as if you are in the coco movie. plz make gameplay longer. cuz this was too short and i want this to be a longer game and you can take part of the entire movie.

Best thing from this is the "extending-arm-grab" mechanics. Maybe someone will use it for upcoming games (feels so much more comfortable opening drawers etc). The rest is boring stuff. Feels like being in one of those parts of amusement parks where there's no rides, only sightseeing for kids. Yes theres the tram "ride" but you just go around the plaza in a circle. The "cheerful day of the dead cartoon" style might be nice for some people. It's free, so 1 more star from the intended 1..

Get me no wrong, Coco VR is a fun playful universe to explore, the theme is present and despite having seen the film, I am certain that they created brief moments for the end-user to feel part of Pixar's universe. What it lacks is emotions. See, one of the wonders of VR is being able to have my 4 year old watch Allumette or Henry for example and feel overwhelmed with emotions, be it sadness or joy, both stories being told without words from a child who's reactions can't be faked. 

Pixar, of all animation companies, is best at conveying these feelings, oh so many times have I cried or laugh out loud at one of their numerous movies as a kid, teenager and an adult and truth be told, I expect it from any Pixar signed piece of art, that is why I knocked 1 star down. Otherwise, this is a flawless app. Cheers!

review_title: Its Disney whats not good about it.
one_reviews_text: this is what i expect from disney good graphics to back up their logo, this made me feel like i was on a ride in Disney. if i was to have one suggestion, when walking in the real world i felt like i was in a invisible box got lag or something when i walk to far from where my charicter is placed in virtual space but thats it awsome experience thanks disney keep it up!

review_title: Quality and brevity, not that much fun
one_reviews_text: There is an actual little world inside this experience, which is an achievement. It didn't really entertain me though, and I'm not sure if it would entertain children, either. If I would have felt more immersed and at ease, I might have appreciated it more. Maybe it's a about the imperfect geometry of present-day VR HMDs. This is a pretty and well-made world, though.

review_title: Very nice but controls need adjustment
one_reviews_text:
The experience is very good quality. This is what I'd like to see more of from Pixar but expanded. The issue here though is the controls were very "finnicky".

Sometimes I could free teleport to locations, some spots I could not and this because frustrating. The larger node based teleport spots should just be deleted. Also after teleporting sometimes I could comfort turn and sometimes not. 

It's a very cool atmosphere and environment and it works but you have to get the controls right! Still giving it 5 stars. (Also would like a smooth locomotion option buried deep in settings because I can handle it like many)
Thank god it was free! No matter how much I press the thumbsticks, I can't move anywhere which makes the game pointless. I keep following the instructions but nothing works.
I love this experience.  The soundscape and music are just as good or better than the amazing visuals.

My fav part was the short train ride (find it by going up the elevator).

This app was a little janky and buggy, but didn't stop me from enjoying overall. Pretty great way to promote their movie, I think.
I thought it was the movie lmao

Enjoyed every minute
No sound problems (as reported elsewhere)
Wish there was more
Loved the art
Really felt I was there
Wished there was full body tracking

review_title: To be dead can be fun
one_reviews_text: What a great, colourful world you can enter here. I love the feeling, the athmosphere created. You just want to stay a while longer, look around, stay in one of the little houses and appartements. This is so much more a reason to own a VR headset than the action games.

I really enjoyed the experiment. A remark : I need to disconnect my thrustmaster wheel from the USB port, because the occulus tracking did not work properly with it. There was some conflicts. This surely needs a bug fix.
Great experience. It's short and sweet but has a lot of optional content if you want to dive into some of the background of the movie.  Highly recommend if you saw the fantastic Coco!

I walked into the little alleyway where you see the movie, then I realized my teleportation was disabled.  Then I realized I was watching a movie advertisement.  I'm very disappointed because there was so much hype about this at Oculus connect... how much did you pay to advertise this advertisement there, Disney?

Absolutely loved this ! I was actually in a Pixar movie :-) 
Of course some things aren't perfect but to me this is a milestone in how amazing VR can be. 
I was 8 years old again ;-)
Looks great with 1.8 SS. I only wish they had some smoothing techniques for the parts where they used 360 video. It was slightly stuttery. Still, very cool.

review_title: Its fun, colorful, free and Pixar ;-)
one_reviews_text: Just try it out! ... pretty decent inverse kinematics, fair amount of interaction (for a free experience at least) and fun for around 20 minutes ... a whole lot better then your average 360 video promo... keep it up!
A great little experience - beautiful art & environment as you'd expect given the Pixar association, and a few fun things to do. Definitely try it with a friend though!

failed to load mono，what does this mean？
could someone give me a hand

review_title: Pixar has nailed it! Wanting more!
one_reviews_text: I stepped into the main area of the game and was in awe by the shear scale! Everything was interactive. I quickly realised that this is something to be experienced with other people, so left and will be coming back with friends tomorrow... :)
I wish more of this world were explorable. All the mechanics are there, and the basic structure is there - let us loose to play around a bit more, please Pixar?

...Was one of the most amazing things I have ever seen in VR! This whole experience does VR very right, it's fun, there's a full body to be in and it's visually stunning. Hats off to the developers. And this is free!
Really nice animation, environment and and overall experience. Sound is glitchy on Oculus.

While i'd love for it to be more expansive and basis of a full game this is how you do a movie tie in... stunning visuals attention to detail audience reacting to video played in the cinema and lot more.


A must have!

While it's certainly very well done in terms of production quality, this is a nice looking, but fairly boring/sedate experience.

Certainly one of the better free movie tie-in experiences, but the bar is pretty low to begin with.

What a fantastic and fun experience. At first my teleport wouldn't work, but I figured it out, had to unplug my Logitech joystick then worked fine. Only thing wish the trolly ride wasn't so fast, but really great stuff.
I just saw the movie with my daughter and it is incredible.  Unfortunately, the software says I have insufficient space to install.  The drive has more than enough space.  Oh, well...

You can tell this is a production from a quality company , smooth and colourful visuals liked the additon of mouth recognition through the microphone! Probably the best FREE experience out there right now ,GET IT!!!
Will make a nice demo for newbies to VR.

review_title: Great piece, more than I thought
one_reviews_text: My daughter says its the best VR thing ever haha, and I'm sure its the best VR movie tie in to date. Beautiful and much more to see and do than I thought.

The environments are beautiful, and it's nice to just stand around and soak it in. The audio positioning is also super impressive, and it helps make it feel like you're in a phsyical place. Two thumbs up.

review_title: If you can´t move within the game
one_reviews_text: It´s free, it´s short, and it´s great fun. I´d like to see more stuff like this. If you can´t move in the game disconnect all other game controller first.
I get no sound after the intro.  When the little boy leaves and it loads the next scene I get no sound. It still plays but without sound it is meaningless.  Reinstalled . No joy at all...

review_title: wonderful, but sound keeps cutting out
one_reviews_text: I've kept having to quit the app because the sound keeps cutting out on the Rift at random places.
Everything was beautiful, this was really well made.
First promotional tie-in that really felt compelling. Blade Runner 2049 experience was good, but didn't quite bring a level of fun or polish like this did. The art is GORGEOUS
It's great to step into the colorful world Pixar created. A completely different and more emmersive experience with friends.

Good! 
Make me want to book a trip to Orlando :)
Quite funny, silly, colorful and cheerful experience. The train ride and stage perfomance left big smile on my face. Definitely worth trying.
With the same GTX 970 I can run the plaza on max GPU settings, but can't run the ride properly even on min GPU settings. So that's 0/5 for the ride and 5/5 for the plaza.

review_title: Okay, that was a lot of fun
one_reviews_text: Definitely one of the best movie tie VR experiences that I have tried.  Very charming and fun.  I was a bit of a goof ball on stage at the end. lol  Good job to everyone involved.
Hi quality experience- it's free and Pixar.  While it would be nice to have a little more interactivity, just being able to wander around in the world of Coco is pretty cool.
This was one of my first experiences with VR multiplayer and I'm sure I'll remember it for a long time.
Pixar clearly spent a lot of time and effort making this VR short, and it shows.  Brilliant and well worth a visit!
This experience has been made very well. The environment is stunning and the emersion is really good. It's a short experience but well worth a shot.
i loved its so much!!!
Stopped at the first room. Cant' do nothing.
Such a great piece! Thanks so much! Now I can't wait for the movie... <3
Very fun experience of what the future holds!  Looking forward to more Disney experiences (hopefully full games) in the future.
Pretty jaw dropping. Beautiful and it was the most immersive VR city I've been in. This is what I wanted VR to be like. Keep doing this, everyone.
this is the sort of thing i like in vr.wish this was 50 times longer.brilliant for your first vr experience
What a beautiful adventure through a PIXAR world. Thank you for this!!!

review_title: You can tell this is done by Pixar
one_reviews_text: Lovely bit of immersion - especially for children.
Absolutely and totally enchanting, so much color... and the train ride! My one criticism you couldn't explore with enough freedom.
I've heard great things and want to enjoy this title, but I cannot get sound to work and there is no Help or Support available??
I only wish there are more of this kind instead of the sci-fi, shooting numbers. No motion sickness. Lots to see & explored.
just beautiful, especially the train ride.
I cant move after the intro. I remove all other controllers, but it does not help.
One of the best cartoon worlds I've seen in VR.  A lot more content then I was expecting for a movie promotion app!

review_title: Lovely! Perfect for show casing vr
one_reviews_text: Given it is not too long, I think its really good for showing off vr to a friend. Child friendly as well.
Too few things to interact with, and it ran poorly on my 8700k+1080ti
world looks amazing, no sound though after initial room with young boy.
Fun and simple interactions, shows glimmers of Pixar greatness
I have been hyped about this movie as well as the VR experience ever since it was announced. Definitely a must do!

review_title: Makes me feel like I am in the movie
one_reviews_text: A little glitchy but still fun
Singing trees and Sparklers!! Amazeballs
nice
Im sure this could be fun, but like others, I cant teleport or move after the intro.
Great VR experience, colorful
Extremely cool way to promote the film. Good job there, Disney.
Would like to have more of this...
A wonderful experience for all. A great time to be had with friends and family.
This is very very special! So many fun things to explore! I can't wait to see the movie!
Really hope there will be more from pixar in the future.
Looks nice but i can't move, no teleport despite it promting me.
kept getting stuck in the first room
Its free, its fun, for sure worth a try.
the game was pretty good :D
Worth it for the little ride at the top of the elevator.
Beautiful, at least for a game that's free...
Very nice promo for the movie.  It was like a ride at Disneyland.
I have no words. It was just amazing.
its too short but so GOOD
Beautiful.
Great job !
Good
Very nice one! Thank you!
Everything was nice
It's wonderful world.
Tracking is wonky and teleport only.
nice little demo and good visuals
Would play again
Beautiful and fun. Thank you.
Can't wait to see the movie~
Worth the download!
Nice demo
Highly recommended app!
Just magical! :D
Wow, just wow...
Wonderfull!

review_title: feels like you are in a amusement park
one_reviews_text: great job pixar!

It was a fun, beautiful time and the world was a pretty immersive world. Beautifully done movie tie-in.

Also, If you don't have many friends with Oculus, I found on Reddit that you can request to co-play with a developer: cocovr.magnopus@magnopus.com. 

They were super helpful and showed me some hidden tips I didn't find by myself and it is SOOOO much more fun with multi-player.

Was great to be dead in a Pixar's colourful  world but i was very surprised to find intersecting geometries bugs and texture stretch in an OFFICIAL Disney's production !
Also, that's cruel against kids to restrain the distribution of this free VR goody within a walled garden ! Shame for that.
I hope you, artists will anderstand how to unleash the power of this new Virtual Reality medium in your next projects. There's so much to be made...

Just 5 minutes in this experience got me invested in a world and characters I knew nothing about. The environment and activities are so colorful and fun, but the real magic is in experiencing this with a friend! Walk around town, wear silly clothes, watch a Pixar short, and realize your potential as a necromancer by influencing a skeletal crowd to mirror your movements. There's a bunch of fun hidden features to find too (try pulling something out of the hat in the art studio)! All-in-all, a fantastic experience worth sharing with others.

Woaw... okay that's the best VR experience I had so far, I wish it will inspire many other future projects! Thank you Pixar for giving me that travel into your world, I hope you will do that for your future movies!

was fun, and explored for hours everything, and i still feel that i missed stuff.
replay value is slim though.
I love the elevator!!! Also the part where you can see the entire plaza.
